item.title: Trump says $72bn Netflix-Warner Bros deal 'could be a problem'
item.description: The planned deal would cement Netflix in its position as the world's biggest subscription streaming service.

item.title: What Australian teens want you to know about the social media ban
item.description: The BBC spoke to under-16s in Sydney, Brisbane and Canberra who will be banned from social media from December 10.

item.title: Water leak in Louvre damages hundreds of books
item.description: The leak in the Egyptian department comes just weeks after a jewellery heist that put the museum's security infrastructure under scrutiny.

item.title: Zelensky due at Downing Street for high-level Ukraine talks
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer will also welcome the leaders of France and Germany as Europe looks to respond to a US-led push for a peace deal.

item.title: Little sleep, no pay: India's poll workers flag harsh conditions amid uproar over deaths
item.description: The deaths of more than a dozen poll workers amid India's massive voter roll revision exercise have set off a controversy.

item.title: Japan is facing a dementia crisis – can technology help?
item.description: Elderly people aged 65 and over now make up nearly 30% of Japan's population.

item.title: 'We deserve to have a say' - Australian teens on the social media ban
item.description: The BBC spoke to under-16s who will be banned from social media from December 10 to get their thoughts on the world-first policy.

item.title: The Papers: Heathrow 'pepper spray attack' and 'Harry gun cop U-turn'
item.description: A pepper spray incident at Heathrow Airport and a Home Office review of Prince Harry's UK protection leads Monday's papers.

item.title: Festive invite overload? How to get better at saying no
item.description: We often end up agreeing to do things we don’t want to do. Here are three ways to help you say no.

item.title: Royal Navy unveils new Atlantic strategy to counter Russian threat
item.description: Experimental underwater drones form part of a new plan to protect the UK's undersea cables and pipelines.

item.title: Wicked or Avatar? Hollywood gears up for Golden Globe nominations
item.description: The Globes are the first major film awards to announce their shortlists as awards season heats up.

item.title: Being together brings us closer to our girls, say Southport families
item.description: Parents of Alice, Bebe and Elsie tell BBC documentary they have supported each other through grief.

item.title: Starmer to host Zelensky for Ukraine talks in London
item.description: The pair will be joined by France's Emmanuel Macron and Germany's Friedrich Merz on Monday.
